sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Juan Diego Rodríguez)
articles.description: Discussing the decisions surrounding JavaScript prototypes, the article by Juan Diego Rodriguez scrutinizes their origin, examines missteps in the design, and explores how these factors have affected the way we write JavaScript today.
articles.title: How Marketing Changed OOP In JavaScript

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Oluwasanmi Akande)
articles.description: Git is designed to assure us that we can track a project’s files at different points in time. But it doesn’t assure us that those files are always safe along the way. For those of you who have dealt with the sinking feeling that you’ve irrevocably deleted and lost files, Sanmi has a couple of approaches that, in the right situations, may help bring them back.
articles.title: Recovering Deleted Files From Your Git Working Tree

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Could there be a better way to welcome the new month than with a collection of desktop wallpapers? We’ve got some eye-catching designs to sweeten up the last few weeks of the year and, if you’re celebrating, to get you in the holiday mood.
articles.title: Cold Days, Shining Lights (December 2023 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Sasha Denisova)
articles.description: In this article, Sasha guides you through crucial processes and factors to achieve a consistent brand presence across platforms. She offers an overview of the entire brand identity process, explores collaboration with UI teams, and provides essential details on the assets required for the successful implementation of a digital brand.
articles.title: Crafting A Killer Brand Identity For A Digital Product

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Geoff Graham)
articles.description: We’re living in somewhat of a CSS renaissance with new features, techniques, experiments, and ideas coming at us to an extent we haven’t seen since “CSS3”. It’s easy to feel overwhelmed when your profession seems to be advancing at breakneck speed, but Geoff Graham considers the ways “modern” CSS in 2023 has actually made CSS “easier” to write.
articles.title: A Few Ways CSS Is Easier To Write In 2023

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Facundo Giuliani)
articles.description: A well-designed composable system should not only consider the technical aspects but also take into account the nature of the content it handles. To help us with that, we can use a Headless Content Management system such as Storyblok.
articles.title: An Introduction To Full Stack Composability

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Temani Afif)
articles.description: In Part 1 of the series, Temani Afif demonstrated how creating ribbon patterns in CSS has evolved with the availability of new CSS features. In this second installment of this brief two-part series, we look at two additional ribbon variations that introduce techniques for masking a repeated background gradient in CSS.
articles.title: CSS Responsive Multi-Line Ribbon Shapes (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Victor Yocco & Dana Daniels)
articles.description: Product teams benefit from knowing their users’ needs and how they respond to product updates as they build out the roadmap of a product. This article covers Voice of Customer programs and is aimed at those who work on a product team as well as executives who are looking for how to better inform your products using insight from users.
articles.title: Creating And Maintaining A Voice Of Customer Program

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Matthew Mattei)
articles.description: Effective collaboration between designers and developers is vital to creating good user experiences. However, bridging the handoff between design and development with the many tools and workflows available today has its pitfalls. Matthew Mattei introduces you to the Uno Platform, which offers a robust set of productivity boosters.
articles.title: An Efficient Design-to-Code Handoff Process Using Uno Platform For Figma

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Temani Afif)
articles.description: Ribbons have been used to accent designs for many years now. But, the way we approach them in CSS has evolved with the introduction of newer features. In this article, Temani Afif combines background and gradient tricks to create ribbon shapes in CSS that are not only responsive but support multi-line text and are easily adjustable with a few CSS variables.
articles.title: CSS Responsive Multi-Line Ribbon Shapes (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Frederick O’Brien)
articles.description: Words alone aren’t enough to safeguard best practices in the world of web design and development. Web design documentation must be like its medium — interactive and constantly evolving.
articles.title: Designing Web Design Documentation

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Oriana García)
articles.description: Animation and accessibility are often seen as two separate powers at odds with one another. How is it possible to strike a balance between elements that move and the possible negative effects they expose to users who are sensitive to motion? Oriana García explains how her team at Mercado Libre tackled the challenge by creating guiding principles for applying animation to user interfaces and incorporating them into the team’s design system.
articles.title: Creating Accessible UI Animations

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ganesh Dahal)
articles.description: WordPress Playground began as an experiment to see what a self-hosted WordPress experience might look like without the requirement of having to actually install WordPress. A year later, the experiment has evolved into a full-fledged project. Ganesh Dahal demonstrates how WordPress Playground works and gets deep into how it might be used.
articles.title: WordPress Playground: From 5-Minute Install To Instant Spin-Up

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Maxwell Barvian)
articles.description: The CSS `clamp()` function is often paired with viewport units for “fluid” font sizing that scales the text up and down at different viewport sizes. As common as this technique is, several voices warn that it opens up situations where text can fail WCAG Success Criterion 1.4.4, which specifies that text should scale up to at least 200% when the user’s browser reaches its 500% maximum zoom level. Max Barvian takes a deep look at the issue and offers ideas to help address it.
articles.title: Addressing Accessibility Concerns With Using Fluid Type

articles.author: Jayant Chowdhary
articles.description: Keeping track of time is a very important aspect of computer programs. Some common use cases are:  * Measure/profile the performance of certain parts of code.  * Do work at certain periods of time, from within a program.   * Detect whether threads are in a deadlock
articles.title: Keeping Time in C++: How to use the std::chrono API

articles.author: Joan Ayebola
articles.description: React is a powerful JavaScript library for building user interfaces. And it has undergone significant changes over the years.  One of the most noteworthy additions is the introduction of hooks, which revolutionized the way developers manage state and side effects in functional components.  In this guide, we'll explore
articles.title: How to Use React Hooks – useEffect, useState, and useContext Code Examples

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: MLOps, short for Machine Learning Operations, refers to the practice of applying DevOps principles to machine learning. Understanding MLOps can help you build production grade machine learning projects. We just posted an MLOps course the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel. MLOps is a cutting-edge field at the intersection of machine learning, data
articles.title: MLOps Course – Learn to Build Machine Learning Production Grade Projects

articles.author: Ayu Adiati
articles.description: A table of contents (or TOC) is a list of chapters or section titles in an article. You'll usually find it at the beginning of an article, right after the introduction. When you write a long blog post or an article with independent sections, consider adding a table of contents.
articles.title: How to Add a Table of Contents to Your Article on Ghost

articles.author: Hunor Márton Borbély
articles.description: Have you ever needed an icon for your website, but you couldn't quite find the right one? Or perhaps you wanted to have a simple diagram, but didn't want to learn a whole new library just for that? Well, good news – you can do all that and more without
articles.title: SVG Tutorial – How to Code Images with 7 Examples

articles.author: Nathan Sebhastian
articles.description: Hello everyone! In this article, I’m going to explain one of the most useful features in JavaScript: the arrow function. I’ll compare the arrow function with the regular function syntax, I'll show you how to convert a regular function into an arrow function easily, and I'll discuss why the arrow
articles.title: How to Use JavaScript Arrow Functions – Explained in Detail

articles.author: Eamonn Cottrell
articles.description: Accordion elements are very handy for displaying topic titles and expandable details below them when you click the title. In this article, I'll walk you through creating an FAQ section with some expandable accordion elements. I'll show you how to do this without any JavaScript, and then we'll add a
articles.title: How to Create HTML Accordion Elements With and Without JavaScript

articles.author: Jayant Chowdhary
articles.description: Clang is a set of tools and projects that provides infrastructure for languages in the C family like C, C++, OpenCL, and CUDA. It is a part of the LLVM [https://www.llvm.org/] project. This article will show you how to use Clang's front end libraries to build a simple static analysis
articles.title: How to Build a Clang AST-Based C++ Static Analysis Tool

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Creating an Instagram clone is a fun project that can help you master important front end development skills. We just published a course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that teaches you how to create an Instagram clone using React and Firebase. Burak Orkmez developed this course. This course is perfect
articles.title: Code and Deploy an Instagram Clone with React and Firebase

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Since APIs are the backbone of software development, effective API documentation is critical.  We just published a course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will teach you how to write good documentation for APIs. You will learn how to craft, automate, and publish API documentation that is not only
articles.title: API Documentation Best Practices Course

articles.author: Joan Ayebola
articles.description: JavaScript is a versatile programming language that empowers developers to create dynamic and interactive web pages.  One of the foundational elements of JavaScript programming is the application of logical operations to make decisions and control program flow.  In this guide, we'll delve into the basics of logical operations
articles.title: How to Use Logic in JavaScript – Operators, Conditions, Truthy/Falsy, and More

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: With the right tools and training, anyone can become a music producer. We just release a course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will teach you advanced music production skills using FL Stuio. Tristan Willcox developed this course. Tristan is a professional music producer with over 10,000 hours in music
articles.title: Advanced Music Production with FL Studio – Tutorial

articles.author: David Clinton
articles.description: Is a public cloud like AWS or Microsoft's Azure the right place to host every  deployment workload at every stage of its life? To be honest, I once thought that that was true – at least 95% of the time. But things have changed. Even though new services are
articles.title: Why You Might Want to Move Your Workloads Out of the Cloud

articles.author: Nathan Sebhastian
articles.description: Hello again, friends! The reduce() method is one of the most confusing Array methods in JavaScript. So in this article, I’m going to help you clearly see how the method works.  I'm also going to show some examples that'll help you understand how and where you may want to
articles.title: How to Use JavaScript's Array reduce() Method – Explained with Examples

articles.author: Nishant Kumar
articles.description: ECMAScript 2023, the 14th edition of the language, has some great changes that will make your programming life easier.  In this article, I'll go through each of the changes and explain why they're helpful. So let’s dive in and see some new methods we got as an early Christmas
articles.title: What's New in JavaScript in 2023 – Changes with Code Examples

articles.author: Nathan Sebhastian
articles.description: Hi everyone! In this article, I’m going to teach you one of the most confusing JavaScript topics, which is the Promise object. Promises may seem difficult at first, but they're actually quite simple once you understand how they work. Here's what we'll cover:  1. How a Promise Works
articles.title: How JavaScript Promises Work – Tutorial for Beginners

articles.author: Jess Wilk
articles.description: In today’s world of technology, we get more recommendations from Artificial Intelligence models than from our friends.  Surprised? Think of the content you see and the apps you use daily. We get product recommendations on Amazon, clothing recommendations on Myntra, and movie suggestions on Netflix based on our past
articles.title: How to Build a Movie Recommendation System Based on Collaborative Filtering

articles.description: Creating projects is very important for expanding your web development portfolio. articles.title: Practice HTML, CSS, and JavaScript in Spanish by Building 7 Projects

articles.author: Sergei Bachinin
articles.description: In this article, we'll thoroughly explore base64 encoding. You'll learn how it came into being and why it's still so prevalent in modern systems. Here's what we'll cover:  1.  What is base64?  2.  Why use base64?  3.  When to use base64  4.
articles.title: What is base64 Encoding and Why is it Necessary?

articles.author: Ashutosh Krishna
articles.description: Python's beauty lies in its simplicity and readability. And mastering the art of writing concise yet powerful code can significantly enhance your productivity as a developer. I'm talking about really short lines of code that do big things. In this article, we'll explore 8 essential Python one-liners that every Pythonista
articles.title: Python One-Liners to Help You Write Simple, Readable Code

articles.description: Ethereum is one of the major pioneers in the decentralized ecosystem. And Web3.js is an essential tool if you're working on Ethereum-based projects.  To fully understand why this tool is important, we must first take a deeper dive into Ethereum development. Grab your coffee, young Web3 enthusiast. We're going
articles.title: Learn Web3.js Basics – Ethereum Development for Beginners

articles.author: Ashutosh Krishna
articles.description: Two-Factor Authentication, or 2FA, is like having an extra lock on the door to your online accounts. Instead of just using a password, 2FA adds another layer of security. It's a bit like needing both a key and a special code to open a vault. Think of it as a
articles.title: How to Implement Two-Factor Authentication with PyOTP and Google Authenticator in Your Flask App

articles.author: Oluwafunmilola Obisesan
articles.description: Feature engineering is an essential step in the data preprocessing process, especially when dealing with tabular data.  It involves creating new features (columns), transforming existing ones, and selecting the most relevant attributes to improve the performance and accuracy of machine learning models.  Feature engineering helps the model understand
articles.title: Feature Engineering Techniques for Structured Data – Machine Learning Tutorial

articles.author: Joan Ayebola
articles.description: Interacting with external APIs, or Application Programming Interfaces, has become an essential skill in web development.  APIs allow different software applications to communicate with each other, enabling developers to access and retrieve data from various sources.  One popular way to perform API requests in JavaScript is by using
articles.title: How to Fetch Data from an API Using the Fetch API in JavaScript

articles.description: Scroll-based animations are triggered when a user scrolls on a webpage. This project prompted me to write a tutorial about how I did that here on freeCodeCamp. The Framer Motion library makes it super
articles.title: How to Create Scroll Animations with React, Tailwind CSS, and Framer Motion

articles.description: The AWS Cloud Project Bootcamp is a free comprehensive training program to equip you with the skills and knowledge to successfully design, build, and implement a cloud project. We just published the entire 107-hour bootcamp on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel. Andrew Brown from ExamPro developed this course. The AWS Cloud
articles.title: Free 107-Hour AWS Cloud Project Bootcamp

articles.author: Quincy Larson
articles.description: On this week's episode of the freeCodeCamp Podcast, I interview hardware engineer and tech founder from Austria. We talk about growing up in the European countryside, his early passion for computers, and ultimately his move to San Francisco, where he's founded several tech companies. Bruno's super excited about embedded systems
articles.title: Podcast: Hardware Engineering with Bruno Haid

articles.author: Quincy Larson
articles.description: Most people’s journey toward learning to program starts with a single late-night Google search. Usually it’s something like “Learn ______” But how do they decide which language to search for? > “They always joke about Java on Silicon Valley. I guess I should learn that.” Or: > “Haskell. So hot
articles.title: What Programming Language Should I Learn First in 2024? [Solved]

articles.author: Quincy Larson
articles.description: 2023 has been an amazing year for the freeCodeCamp community.  I'm so grateful for the many kind volunteers who have helped us advance our mission of creating open learning resources. Over the past 12 months, the freeCodeCamp community has:  * Merged 2,753 code contributions into our open source
articles.title: freeCodeCamp's Top Open Source Contributors of 2023

articles.author: Joan Ayebola
articles.description: JavaScript, the language of the web, empowers developers to create dynamic and interactive web pages. One of the key features that enables this interactivity is Document Object Model (DOM) manipulation.  DOM manipulation allows developers to interact with and modify the structure, style, and content of web pages. In this
articles.title: DOM Manipulation in JavaScript – A Comprehensive Guide for Beginners

articles.description: Django model fields define the structure of a database within a Django web application. Using this essential component will keep your work organized and help you make fewer mistakes in your code. This article will discuss some common Django model fields and how to use them in your code. To
articles.title: Django Model Fields – Common Use Cases and How They Work

articles.description: > Hey {username}, we've merged a PR before yours. Please resolve the merge conflicts so we can review and merge your PR. Have you ever received that kind of message from a maintainer while waiting for your pull request to be reviewed and merged? And then, you're panicking because you
articles.title: How to Keep Branches Up-to-Date and Resolve Merge Conflicts in GitHub and VS Code

articles.author: Tatev Aslanyan
articles.description: Do you want to break into Data Science in 2024? Then you should consider trying to get your first Data Science internship.  Internships can help you gain invaluable experience and set you up for success in the ever-evolving field of Data Science. But with fierce competition, limited opportunities, unclear
articles.title: How to Get Your First Data Science Internship

articles.author: Vahe Aslanyan
articles.description: If you're regularly confronted by the complexity of modern data, you’re not alone. In our data-centric world, understanding data structures isn’t optional — it’s essential.  Whether you’re a novice coder or an experienced developer, this handbook is your concise guide to the critical skill of data management through data structures. Data
articles.title: Data Structures Handbook – The Key to Scalable Software

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Scikit-learn is an open-source machine learning library for Python, known for its simplicity, versatility, and accessibility. The library is well-documented and supported by a large community, making it a popular choice for both beginners and experienced practitioners in the field of machine learning. We just published an 18-hour course on
articles.title: Machine Learning with Python and Scikit-Learn

articles.description: Go, or Golang, is a powerful programming language known for its simplicity, efficiency, and strong support for concurrent programming. It's a favorite among developers for building scalable web applications, cloud services, and more. We just released a Go course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that walks you through building three
articles.title: Go Language for Encryption – Tutorial

articles.description: LangChain is an AI-first framework designed to enable developers to create context-aware reasoning applications by linking powerful Large Language Models with external data sources. We just published a course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will teach you all about LangChain. The course will equip you with the cutting-edge skills
articles.title: Learn LangChain to link LLMs with external data

articles.author: TAPAS ADHIKARY
articles.description: What does the word career mean to you? To me, it is a roller coaster journey during which we find opportunities, progress, and growth in life. The journey involves learning objectives, work, and other personal and professional aspects. A promising career is one where you enjoy most (if not all)
articles.title: Career Mistakes to Avoid as a Developer

articles.description: Several months ago, I stumbled upon a coding challenge that intrigued me. Here's what it was: > Fun frontend question I was asked in an interview one time Build six squares with no color Every time you click one, it turns green When the last square turns green, they all
articles.title: How to Build Successful Projects as a Junior Developer

But sometimes it would be nice if there were a visualization showing the algorithms behind these problems.  In this tutorial, we
articles.title: How to Build a Visualization for Leetcode's Two Sum Problem – HTML, CSS, & JavaScript Project

articles.description: User authentication is critical to mobile app development. It helps make sure that only authorized users can access sensitive information and perform actions within an application. In this tutorial, we will explore how to build secure user authentication in Flutter using Firebase for authentication and the Bloc state management pattern
articles.title: How to Build a Secure User Authentication Flow in Flutter with Firebase and Bloc State Management

One of the fundamental building blocks of JavaScript programming is the if  statement. if statements allow developers to control the flow of their programs by making decisions based on
articles.title: How to Use If Statements in JavaScript – a Beginner's Guide

In particular, all methods of the telegram.Bot class that make requests to the Bot API are now coroutine functions and need
articles.title: How to Build and Deploy a python-telegram-bot v20 Webhook

We talk about what it's like to get a Ph.D. under one of the pioneers of data visualization. We also talk about how he
articles.title: Podcast: Data Visualization with Dr. Curran Kelleher

articles.title: JavaScript Game Tutorial – Build a Stick Hero Clone with HTML Canvas + JavaScript

articles.description: Have you ever wondered how websites can offer their content in multiple languages, perfectly tailored to different cultures and regions?  Well, that magic is called localization, and it's a game-changer for web development – especially when using Django, a super versatile Python framework.  It's not just about translating
articles.title: How to Localize Your Django App

articles.title: ChatGPT vs BARD AI – What's the Difference?

articles.title: Podcast: From MIT to Startup Land with Arian Agrawal

articles.title: How to Setup Authentication and Protected Routes in Next.js 13 with next-auth.js

articles.title: How to Use the Segment Anything Model (SAM) to Create Masks

articles.title: JavaScript Course in Spanish  – Learn JavaScript for Beginners

articles.title: How to Build an Online Résumé on AWS Using S3, Route 53, CloudFront, and ACM

articles.description: In order to write scalable, reusable, and maintainable applications with React, you'll need to go beyond the surface of using React components, useEffect, useContext, useState, and the like. It involves learning in detail how React works in more depth.  And if you don't properly understand these key React concepts,
articles.title: How to Avoid Prop Drilling in React

articles.author: Juan P. Romano
articles.description: In this tutorial, you will learn how to build a simple whiteboard app using Python and Tkinter. Some months ago, I was teaching a Python course. I was struggling to convey certain concepts because it was an online course, and I couldn't use a whiteboard or even a traditional board.
articles.title: How to Build a Whiteboard App with Python and Tkinter

Through this article, you will learn how to declare and mutate variables using  var, let, and const,
articles.title: How to Declare Variables in JavaScript – var, let, and const Explained

articles.title: How to Write Components that Work in Any Framework
